Reviews.Title: “Think Premier Inn and you won't be dissapppointed”
Reviews.Author: a4cmt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights while flat hunting with our Spanish speaking daughter. The best thing about this Hotel is the location which is relatively quiet whilst very central, being on a small road just south of Gran Via and just north of Plaza del Sol. Large parts of the surrounding area is pedistrianised and there are many shops, cafes and other historic sights such as Plaza Mayor all within an easy walk. Also 2 subway stations closeby (clean, cool and quick) with connections to Prada Museum etc. There is also a full size train staion UNDER Plaza del Sol, allowing you to travel right out of the city without using the Metro. The Hotel itself is modern and clean and just about lives up to its 3 stars. Our room was very small for a twin/double and the beds were hard. The shower room was 'one at a time' size, but well fitted and clean. Staff were all friendly and the buffet breaffast was as good as you get in Spain. At the right price this is an excellent hotel. We paid the prebooked rate of only 56 Euros incl breakfast and you can't argue with that for the centre of a capital city - but I noted the rack rate in reception was 167 euros per night, which is way over what this standard of accomodation is worth. Essentailly it is a 'Premier Inn' in a great location in the city centre. Recommended, if you don't mind hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Would return!”
Reviews.Author: douza
Reviews.Content: Well, this is my most satisfied hotel during my two weeks' trip in Spain. It' a small charming old-fashioned hotel: centrally located (2 min walk to metro station Sol and Callao), very friendly staff, clean& comfortable room, breakfast with wide selections, and it's only 56 Euros per night for a twins room including breakfast (My friend and I stayed for 4 nights)! What can I cay! I highly recommend II Castillas , it's of super great value! Next time I visit Madrid, I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the middle of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: plavaseka
Reviews.Content: Location: This hotel is in a great location, just off Gran Via and about a 5-7 min walk from Puerta Del Sol, which is a great open area where you can people watch and sit and enjoy the atmosphere. Staff: The staff was excellent, extremely helpful, and friendly. They gave a great alternate suggestion for seeing a flamenco show at a place called Las Tablas, rather than send us to a typical overpriced tourist tour for a flamenco show. It was a great show and we thanked them for it. Food: A wide variety of breakfast foods ( we had included breakfast), toast, pastries, fruit, juice, coffee,tea, cheeses, sliced meats, cereal, yogurt, many choices for most people. Price: THe hotel was reasonably priced for the season. Not over priced and you got what you paid for. Room: Clean, 2 single beds, mirrored closet and safe. The bathroom was very clean and basic toiletries were provided. Towel service is there to change towels every day if you like, or you can save water and re-use them. Same idea pertains to the bed linens. Rubbish was emptied out every day and anything that you needed for the room was provided. Over all I would rate this hotel a 9/10. Coming from the "western" world, i feel that for the amount we paid we got a grea deal. As a European hotel, well seasoned travellers as myself, expect things to be different than what we are used to at home, however this hotel lived up to the things we needed to enjoy our trip in Madrid. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Spanish Hotel Centrally located in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: EdDenmark
Reviews.Content: You can't find a hotel in Madrid that is more centrally located. Clean old-fashioned and charming, VERY Spanish hotel. A very friendly staff, with a good solid Spanish breakfast at a very reasonable rate. Third time I've stayed here with friends, and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of Madrid, cheap as chips”
Reviews.Author: conker89
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Madrid on a Stag Do. The best man was set the task of finding basic accommodation, central to Madrid at a reasonable price. I would have to say that on those points, this hotel ticks the boxes. Close to the metro, fast food and bars - it is perfect for Stag parties and those trying to save a few quid when going abroad. The hotel itself was basic, we had an incident where the mirror fell off of the wall and smashed but other than that, i would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomended!”
Reviews.Author: NohaW
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel II Castillas for 2 nights and was very pleased with everything. The location of the hotel is just perfect, right in the heart of Madrid and close to all the main attractions and the area around the hotel is lively and safe. We walked everywhere, but there are also 2 metro stations nearby (Callao & Sol) for those who don't want to walk. Stayed with 2 friends in a triple room, and it was quite roomy with the 3 beds; with enough space for all of us to move around the room and put our bags. The room was spotless clean. Also the staff were so nice and very helpful. The price/quality is perfect! Total value for money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Maureen M
Reviews.Content: We recently visited this hotel and were very pleased with our stay. It was spotlessly clean in all areas. The rooms we had were smart/traditional with modern bathrooms, spotless bedding, nice fixtures and fittings with white voile curtains, matching bed covers and draw curtains. There were no scuffs or marks to be found anywhere on the walls or paintwork. The breakfast was varied and there was something for everyone. All the staff were very pleasant, friendly and helpful, especially the young barman who was working the night of the Spain v Italy Euro 2012 game, it was his first day and he was lovely. The hotel is just off one of the main streets, Grande Via, a very good central location. We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in the heart of Peurto Del Sol”
Reviews.Author: NilePearl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel II Castillas in January 2012. The location is perfect in the heart of Peurto Del Sol and within walking distance to El Prado. It's clean and the breakfast is basic but good. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient, total value!”
Reviews.Author: Ellida83
Reviews.Content: This place was so centrally located, we were smack in the middle of all the action. If you like being in the thick of the city you're visiting, without paying big bucks to be there, then you absolutely must check into Castillas. The service was fantastic, everyone either spoke English or tried extremely hard to help out whatever way they could. We were in a bit of a frenzy and turned up on a Thursday with our luggage and nothing booked. No rooms were available for us that night, but they kindly offered a discount rate for Friday - even though they really didn't have to. It might not be the fanciest of facilities, but it's clean, well kept and is charming enough without all the unnecessary 5 star frills.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what you pay, but has no character or soul.”
Reviews.Author: Matarsak Z
Reviews.Content: This place is like a clean SUPER8 or Motel6. Very very basic but clean and sufficient hotel in the heart of Madrid. If you want to stay in the Puerto Del Sol area on a budget, this is likely the best choice. Of course Madrid has far better hotels, but it will cost you more. The staff are helpful, but the hotel really has nothing more than clean rooms, with the most basic furniture and amenities. I wasn't too pleased with the state of linens, towels, and worn blankets. Basically it’s a place to lay down your head at night, I would not want to hang out in these rooms too long – they are too stale and uninteresting, and ours had barely any light. Our bath/shower was fine, with great water pressure, except for the half-way glass barrier that is typical of some European tubs, and holds no water in while you shower. However, our other parties in our group had a shower stand in which no person even slightly overweight would easily fit – much in the manner of a tight cruise ship shower stall. The wood panels at the floor of this stall expanded and shrunk with water and temperature changes, causing strange noises. I hate to think what could be growing under that wood. Breakfast was good, many choices, with the exception of coffee, which was dismal as per usual for Spanish 2 to 3 star hotels --utilizing a machine to dispense something approaching very weak brown water. Our room looked into a courtyard which was actually a series of private apartments, with clothes lines running across the courtyard. The residents would speak from window to window and you would hear the conversations at random times. Depending on your perspective you could find being party to these conversations charming, or annoying. The place doesn’t have much soul, but is good value for the price and certainly a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “old face hotel”
Reviews.Author: mualibarut
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed 3 nights .why ı said old face lobyy is decoreted classic .looks nice but rooms are look old .because rooms are a bit dark and bed covers are dark colour .makes it overall old face.ı recommend them to make the rooms light colours by paintings and bed covers ect.location of the hotel is really very good we had read that as being on the narrow street hotel is close to center and quiet at night. but maybe has changed since .because drunk people are loudly talking or screaming all nights.hotel has a good breakfast.helpful and friendly receptıon.rooms and bathroom big enough.we expected a free laptop or desktop does not matter old or used one but ı believe there should be free wi-fi and computer for customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: WebWizards
Reviews.Content: Although our taxi driver had difficulty finding this hotel, it is actually conveniently located. Especially good was its proximity to a branch of El Corte Ingles, a department store offering many reasonably priced souvenirs with a full supermarket in the basement. The room was comfortable, but the shower is tiny. Front desk service was helpful and accommodating. The full breakfast offers something for everyone, and is staffed by a very pleasant hostess.

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: flyguyNottingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights, I realy dont think your going to find a better hotel better placed or better priced. hotel is well decorated with a lovely caffe bar restraunt serving good food. All the staff are helpfull and very pleasant. Our room was not hughe but clean and adequate, nice firm beds. We also had a lovely bathroom. Bonus of a daily stocked mini bar in the room nice touch. Breakfast was enjoyable plenty of choice, hot food and usual coisants, cereal, toast , yogurt and fresh fruit.Hotel is perfectly placed only a 5min walk to puerto del Sol and The Grand Via all other major sites abouit half an hour pleasant stroll with loads of local tapas bars and cafe's on route, in our opinion you wont want to miss this gem in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMichael
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for a visit to Madrid. Most sites are within walking distance. The breakfast was more than adequate with good OJ, great coffee, ham, cheese, breads, etc - everything for a Spanish breakfast including the tortilla. The room was clean with plenty of room. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 186605Beachbum
Reviews.Content: Three friends and myself stayed at Il Castillas recently and were delighted with our stay. It is a bright, comfortable Spanish style hotel, conveniently located for exploring Madrid and for using the Metro. It was kept spotlessly clean with marble floors and nice leather couches in the foyer area, and also a bar and restaurant. The staff couldn't have been more helpful to us and friendly. The bedrooms are reasonably spacious and are cleaned to a high standard. We found it very quiet at night. We very much enjoyed the breakfast each morning, which was always fresh with cold meats and cheeses, fruit, juices, toast and cakes and also scrambled eggs and bacon. Overall, a most enjoyable experience and we would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “In need of some tender love and care”
Reviews.Author: British32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here following a recommendation. It must have changed since my friend stayed here. There seems to be a problem with the management. Housekeeping is poor, e.g. Part ripped towels and broken showers. The service at breakfast is rude and unforgiving. The waitress could not have done more to make it clear that we were all not welcome and should hurry up and leave.... A better manager and I'm sure the hotel will be fine, perhaps I came on a bad weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_Chiara
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights the room was quiet, clean enough spacious and the location was good for metro or a nice walk in the center. Good breakfast too. We paid 177 € for two nights incl breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AnuP2D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the past 3 nights on a vacation in Spain - this hotel is located in a perfect place - central to all amenities and 150 m away from the nearest Metro station (Callao). We could walk down to all major attractions. The rooms were clean and reasonably large. The breakfast was plentiful with a lot of choices. Reception staff were warm and helpful. Wifi was pretty useful. All in all, great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not at best but decent quality !”
Reviews.Author: Billyintrav
Reviews.Content: Like many travellers, we decided to go for this hotel on the basis of its good reviews at the time and decent price. And certainly we agreed mostly with what said in those reviews. The room we had was luckily not faced directly to a bar, so it was quite quiet. The customer service was good enough, at a average standard. Nothing about the hotel was outstanding, although we did visited the hotel's restaurant several times due to some decent and good quality food they served. That is probably one big plus point when staying here. On overall, it is average, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BarryChapman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at II Castillas, and all in all the stay was very satisfactory. My room, and the hotel in general was clean and comfortably. The location is excellent, only a 5 min walk to Sol, the heart of the city. The major museums, palace and other tourist destinations are well within walking distance. It is also in a major shopping district, and not far from various restaurants and bars. The staff were very helpful (English spoken). The buffet breakfast was quite sufficient. There is also a restaurant connected, which I didn't use, but the advertised "Plata de la dia" seemed good value.One thing, I was on the firth floor, and glad to be so as the streets are very noisy, so can imagine bedrooms on the lower floors been quite noisy. I would happily stay at II Castillas again, or recommend it to friends. I

Reviews.Title: “Add room 103 to the list of rooms to avoid”
Reviews.Author: ualsu
Reviews.Content: As many other travelers have mentioned, the location is really wonderful. You can not beat the location and the value. The room was pretty small. The bathroom was enormous. The breakfast was very satisfactory. The service was mixed. The men at the desk were either very helpful or very uninterested. Room 103 (and I imagine most of the rooms on the first floor that are directly above the restaurant)should be avoided. They start moving tables to mop the floors very early in the morning and it creates a racket. Further, the heating unit was malfunctioning in my room. Unfortunately the only way to cool it down was to open the windows. Because of the noise from the street it was very loud at night. I would suggest a room higher in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Roo
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel II Castillas and chose it because of Trip Advisor - what a great find! The location was excellent and the price couldn't be beat. There are pleanty of sights within walking distance - in fact, I took the Metro to and from the airport, that's it! (**If you take the Metro from the airport, be advised that you will need to carry your luggage up and down the stairs - something I didn't think of when lugging my 50lb. bag around!) Major sights within a 10 - 15 minute walk in either direction. The best part was that I would go out for a few hours and then stop back at my room to use the restroom or drop off something I bought. There was a lively atmosphere right around the corner from the hotel but you could not hear any noise while in your room. The room was comfy, nothing glamorous and I had a room next to the elevator. This was not a problem for me and the noise wasn't too terrible. The TV is little and I only used it for catching up on the US daily news. Free internet was great and download/upload speed was just fine. The only thing the room didn't have that I would have liked was an alarm clock. Breakfast was perfectly acceptable - I don't know why other reviews said it wasn't good! It was a traditional European breakfast with cold cuts, toast, fruit and cereal; there were a few other items and I found everything to be quite tasty! On my next trip to Madrid, I will definitely stay at Hotel II Castillas again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but I had a bad room!!”
Reviews.Author: SolotravellerEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay in this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. Everyone mentioned how good the location is, and it really is superb. Calle de la Abada is a quiet side street off Gran Via, and you literally are in the middle of everything. From the hotel its a 1 min walk to Callao metro and 3 at a push to Gran Via. 5 min walk to Puerta del Sol and only a few minutes more to Plaza Mayor. From the Plaza Mayor it's another 5 mins max to Palacio Real - everything is in walking distance from the hotel. The metro system is really easy to use and it's very clean, which made travelling to the Bernabaeu, Retiro Park and Ventas (where the famous bull-ring is) a doddle. One recommendation is to make sure that you have a map ready for when you arrive for the first time at Callao or Gran Via on the metro. The hotel is a stone's throw from Calloa but it took me ages to find it without a map. The only criticism I have of this hotel was my room. Avoid room 607 at all costs. It's on the top floor and situated between a lift shaft (which was in constant use) and a fire escape. The room was really noisy and you can hear everyone walking around on the floor right through to the early hours. Apart from that, the staff were friendly and I was able to leave my bag at the hotel for a few hours after I checked out as I had an evening flight. Due to my bad experience with the room I probably wouldn't stay here again - but for location it is faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: MilanoTraveler007
Reviews.Content: We went to Madrid for a weekend and stay at this hotel. Its location is awesome!! We didn't use the Metro at all and just walked everywhere we want to. (Sol, Mayore, Retiro gardens, the palace etc.) The double glazed windows are doing the work, so the room is quiet. The service was great and the reception guys were very helpful and well English speakers. Breakfast buffet has all we need and food was fresh. (Nice variety, with no overhead). Our room was very cozy, with a king size double bed and bathroom was very nice and clean. The TV is very small, but we didn't use it, so it wasn't an issue for us. We asked for a late checkout, due to our flight schedule, and they had no problem with it. For summary, I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ABsChristchurch
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect location for tourist Madrid. A few metres to subway, Gran Via shopping, and only 10 minutes walk to nightlife areas, tapas bars, cafes, with lots of choice. The hotel rooms are typically European, that is on the small side, but comfortable, perfectly clean and good bathrooms - everything worked! Breakfasts were average and OK, bearing in mind they don't go in for cereals and fresh bread/toast much in this part of the world. Front desk staff were courteous and helpful if not bubbling over and we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Decidedly average”
Reviews.Author: Continent_Jumper
Reviews.Content: Rooms and facilities Having tried and failed to get a corner room on check-in, which according to the Lonely Planet guide, is the best type of room to get as they are larger with more windows, we settled for a room lookng out onto the side street. The room was an average size for a city centre hotel, with a tiny TV with mostly Spanish channels, but a very deent sized bathroom, which was a nice surprise. This had his n' hers sinks, a hairdryer, bidet and, most surprisingly, a power shower cabinet with integrated massage jets and lighting system. This was a real pleasure to use and almost made up for the fact that we had to make do with two single beds, as apparently the hotel doesn' t have any doubles. This is one of my bugbears, being frequent travelers, we encounter this a lot. How hard is it to offer a double bed? Location Located on Calle de la Abada, just of the Gran Via, the location is almost faultless. You are steps away from the action but not so near to the main strip to get a sleepless night due to the noise and constant car beeping. Also, the Madrid Metro system is a doddle to use, much easier than London, with the Callao and Gran Via Metro stops minutes away. From the airport it is quite straightforward, take Line 8 to Neuvos Ministerios, change to Line 10 go to Tribunal then change to Line 1 and one stop later you're in Gran Via, which is a five minute walk to the hotel. As for Madrid itself, it is a very nice city with plenty to do, we did a lot of walking, shopping and gallery viewing. Guests The hotel was mainly full of Spanish clientele, which was never a problem. Food The main reason for steering clear of this hotel has to be the buffet breakfast. The choice is fairly uninspiring with meat, meat and more meat. If this isn't your thing you have to make do with half decent croissants, stale cakes and some sorry looking tinned fruit. The cleanliness of the cups, plates and dining area left a lot to be desired and instead of a hearty breakfast we had to pick our food carefully. Staff Our room was always cleaned immaculately but the grumpy man on reception who never gave any more information than was necessary, was a turn off. Overall, this hotel offers a great location but that's about it. The breakfast was a real dissapointment and for £70 a night you're looking for a better standard than this.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago and it was ok. The location is great (really good) and there is a large breakfast. The bathroom is very big and the beds were comfortable. It was a warm day in March and we wanted to open the windows for fresh air, but the windows only opened a few inches at the top (we had a room overlooking the street). I guess the A/C hadn't been turned on yet since it was still the beginning of spring. There was a bit of street noise so I would request a room not facing the street. I think there is a bar or strip club nearby with a lot of late night traffic. For restaurants nearby- we hightly recomend Extremadura, located at Calle Libertad 13. Great food at good value and very likable staff. We had the veal with mushroom sauce and it was great! They have and English menu and the servers are very nice. Definitely not a tourist place, but a genuine Spanish experience that is super close to the Gran Via. Here is a link with more info: [--]

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Mrsheathershaw
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location. Rooms are small but very clean and the 2 sink bathrooms are excellent. Staff helped us change the time of our airport transfer for no charge. Breakfast was fine and the coffee delicious. An excellent capital city hotel.( as stated on other reviews the airport transfer driver got very lost and we spent a lot of time in the red light district looking for the hotel,even with sat nav he had to use my tourist map!)

Reviews.Title: “II (dos) Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: djb1gator
Reviews.Content: Great location only one block off Gran Via. Despite being in a pedestrian district, cab was able to drop us right at the door. Only 1 block to Callao Metro station and 3 or so blocks to either Gran Via or Sol Metro stations. All the main sights from the Prado to the Palacio Real are within reasonable walking distance. Hotel is newly remodeled, very modern, and immaculately clean. Breakfast included a good assortment of coffee, juices, fruits, eggs, meats, breads and pastries. Front desk is courteous and professional. An excellent value in the heart of Old Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart..........”
Reviews.Author: jimmihunt31
Reviews.Content: What a fab hotel. 3 * but we stayed at a 4* in March and this was miles better. Right next to the main shopping area but not that close that it is noisy. Great access to Metro (SOL is the closest). I requested a king size bed when we went, don't ask don't get I thought. To my surprise we got one as well as a mini bar/hairdryer, twin sink bathroom, power shower that was fab, great decor, TV (only one English channel but we were never in as to good weather and so much to do). Room was just like the brochure. Breakfast was the usual self service buffett with a good mix for all and to a good standard. Hotel restaurat is expensive but with so many places to eat this is not a problem. Reitro park is worth a visit, especially at weekends for a row on the lake (4 euros for 45min) or a beer and wtch the world go by. All in all a fab hotel in an amazing location. Would use this one again should we go back. James & Sam - Poole - UK

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Horsiedad
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Good value. Small, like most European hotels, but not too cramped. Great location near Gran Via (the main business/shopping street). Walking distance to most of the sites in Madrid. Receptionist speaks decent English, though not terribly friendly. Nice, but expensive restaurant. Recommended sites to see in/near Madrid: Prado Museum, Toledo (take the train and tour yourself), Escorial (the original palace), and the Valley of the Fallen. Though we didn't get there ourselves, Segovia is highly regarded.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: beekay458
Reviews.Content: After some of the other hotels we stayed in during our nine city tour of Spain, I was initially disappointed with the small, dark, spartan room. The location on Abada Street (which means rhinoceros in Spanish!) is just off the Gran Via and Carmen St. It is a short walk to the major plazas, restaurants and stores. We did not take the Metro but understand that that is a convenient option. We did walk and took a few cab rides. We eventually realized that the II Castillas is a good value for the price: clean, quiet, good AC, and boasting excellent security. The security is definitely needed because there is a major "street of prostitution" one small block away! The hotel is locked at night and you have to be buzzed in to enter. One small complaint is that the lobby lights are dimmed to semi-darkness at night. I don't know if this is an energy saver or a feeble attempt to create atmosphere. Occassionally it took a long time for hot water to come to the sink. We had a full enclosure around our shower so the typical water-in-the-floor was not an issue. The busy staff was helpful in finding us a large taxi to take 4 people & lots of baggage to the airport. There is a large coin-op internet cafe just around the corner, so you can check your email. Great value for 113 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: lily67
Reviews.Content: We were wary when this hotel dropped from No 1 on TA to somewhere in the 60's. No need for concern. Our twin room was immaculate and a reasonable size with street view (Rm 403) - the doubles looked smaller/darker. Large bathroom, powerful shower and a bath, hairdryer. Air con and comfy enough beds. The breakfast was fab - hams, cheeses, fruit, juices, yoghurts smoked salmon, scrambled eggs etc. The only downside was the AWFUL 'classical'!? muzak which played all through breakfast. Turn it off please! Staff were polite, not friendly. Got there from airport with a couple of changes to Metro Calleo on Gran Via, then a 3 min walk to hotel. (2 euros each) Perfect central location for all sightseeing. Good value - was only £60 pnight, booked through central reservation site. When we are on a city break we dont spend much time in the hotel so no need for 'luxuries' at extra cost. Would recommend and give top marks for value, cleanliness and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: cbc27
Reviews.Content: Absolutely satisfied with the hotel. Since we had arrived in Madrid at 8:00am (and hadn't gotten any sleep on the plane), we were anticipating a long wait to check in. Instead we were assigned a room by 9:30 am and were able to rest before adventuring into Madrid. The room was large and clean with a great marble bathroom. Had his/her sinks and bathtub. Great location to all attractions (we didn't even have to use the metro as walking wasn't a problem). Resturant in hotel has good lunch prices (el menu del dia), but the dinner prices are a little expensive. Overall, we are very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lobos3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel II Castillas and were pleased with our room. The hotel is located on a small street near the Gran Via. The room was very clean with all of the necessary amenities. Internet usage is free if the traveler has his/her own laptop and network cable. The breakfast buffet is fine. There is no on-site parking, but a for-fee parking garage is located near the hotel. We would recommend Hotel II Castillas to Madrid visitors.

Reviews.Title: “The II Castillas was absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Spook55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have both traveled through Europe before, so when we checked into Dos Castillas for a few nights' stay in Madrid, we were expecting a tiny room with minimal amenities and lots of street noise. Boy, were we amazed and incredibly pleased! PROS: First, the location is fabulous. We were about 2-3 "blocks" away from Puerta del Sol (there's a metro stop there), shopping, and tons of awesome tapas bars. The hotel itself is on a little side street with minimal traffic, so we never heard any street noise AT ALL...which is rare in a hotel in Madrid. The room we had was HUGE! Again, a big surprise. We booked a double room, and were given a corner room with (a) a view, (b) a king-size bed, and (c) an enormous bathroom with plenty of toiletry samples. We stayed there for an additional night after returning from five days in Sevilla, and we asked to be given a corner room again since we loved the first one so much. The gave it to us, and that one even had a bathtub! I didn't even know 3-star hotels in Europe had rooms with bathtubs in the bathrooms. The breakfast they serve downstairs is awesome...pastrys, cold cuts, chorizo, breads, fruit, cereals, and fresh cheeses. Loved it! CONS: Really, there weren't many at all. The bed was on the hard side, but I think most hotel beds in the 2- to 3-star range in Europe are like that. The staff was friendly enough, but not what I could call overly warm and gracious...very formal. I read in other reviews that the hotel can be hard to find. We took a taxi to the hotel several times (always with a Google map of it just in case), and our drivers never had a problem with it. However, if you come from the Metro with your luggage, have a good Google map because it is a little out of the way. OVERALL: I would heartily recommend this hotel! The price was more than fantastic for what we got during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Location”
Reviews.Author: Wirral_Tripor
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive of going to this hotel like others we booked on the back of rave reviews,We tempted fate and checked the website before we left (not to be recommended) and worried about the final leg of our trip.We arrived back yesterday in UK to write this review.What do people want for their money we paid Euros 90 including breakfast and though it excellent value for money for a major city,would describe the room small (306) but more than adequate, you don't stay in the hotel for 24 hrs or maybe some people do.This Hotel is in a fantastic location ,central to all the sights,resturants,bars and shopping, spotlessly clean.friendly staff the breakfast was basis but more than ample to set you up for the day.Negative my husband is over 6' tall and found the shower head too short for him to shampoo his hair and if your inclined to bathe rather than shower then you are going to be disappointed,apart from that it was a winner and very good value hotel we would definitely go back. Take the metro from the airport approx 30 mins (2 changes) costs two euros per person to Station Callao on the Grand Via, the hotel is a two minute walk to Calle de Abada where the hotel is located near to the El Cortes Ingles Parking bay.Highlights for peace and quiet visit Parque del Retiro beautiful grounds and take a walk to district Chueca a bit scruffy but nice coffee shops and boutiques less crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Good location from which to explore Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CCMM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located off Gran Via, a busy street with numerous shops and from where you can pick up one of the open top buses to explore Madrid. The hotel room where we stayed was comfortable and spotless and I liked the novelty of the his and her washbasins. However there was one very silly design feature to the shower. There is a glass door that extends only halfway down the length of the bath tub which could mean a very wet bathroom floor after someone having a shower. The floor towels really need to be used to avoid slipping on the tiled floor. I couldn't help feeling the old fashioned shower curtain would have done a much better job! We enjoyed the breakfast food both mornings as they supply both hot and cold food and is great for setting you up for a day touring around the city of Madrid. The only downside was that I had to knock on the kitchen door to ask for cutlery. I didn't really mind this on the first morning but when it happened again the second morning I went away with a feeling of the service being a bit sloppy. I would rate this as an average hotel and it's a pity because it could be so much better if they just fixed a few small minor things. I'm sure there are other hotels in Madrid that can do a better job.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel / Good location”
Reviews.Author: BMRC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Castillas with my husband from Apr 12th to 16th.Made our decision to stay here based on good reviews. Bit surprised to see it has dropped in the ratings recently but then I would agree that its initial rating was perhaps too high. Our room was on the 6th floor and was an inside room which made it very quiet. We did hear loud talking though late at night so the walls are somewhat thin. Our room was very clean and recently refurbished. The laminate floor was unexpected for a hotel room and the "plastic" wood trimming on the furniture wasn't very luxurious. Bathroom was good though with two sinks and a good shower. Pillows were in short supply too but we managed. Breakfast was fine- good variety on offer but the buffet area got very busy around 9.30 and the two girls on duty found it hard to cope. I did miss the fact that there were no cereals offered. The hotel is in an excellent location for seeing Madrid and it makes things so much easier for travelling on foot. While the metro to the airport is easy to use it was necessary to take 3 trains and a shuttle bus to Terminal 4 for our flight .Not that easy with suitcases and crowded trains. All in all I would recommend this hotel. It was comfortable, quiet for the most part and good value at €113 per night with tha added bonus of breakfast being provided. Would have loved tea/coffee making facilities for that reviving cuppa after a day's walking!

Reviews.Title: “Nobody ever heard of it???!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghJude27
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Puerto Del Sol about 11pm and asked a local taxi where thehotel was ..... never heard of it!! Asked the next driver, again never heard of it! This happened about 6/7 times and that was with showing people the name and address on paper! Eventually a taxi took us to the hotel, but even then he was unsure of location! Next day we realised how close we were to Puerto del Sol but astounded that not one person could locate the hotel!! Hotel itself is central, clean and comfy. Breakfast is very basic and you have to show up early to be guaranteed breakfast! Staff don't put out new food after 10am. Ribs across the road is lovely for food and we used Metro to get around Madrid. A nice hotel but i'm quite sure it's not the best in Madrid!!

Reviews.Title: “Far from Madrid's best”
Reviews.Author: London Frequent Traveller
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we booked this hotel on the basis of its No. 1 ranking at the time. It certainly didn't live up to that position. The room we were shown faced directly to a bar which was making a lot of noise and looked as if it would go on doing so during the night. We got moved to an inside room (always a wise precaution in Madrid) which was adequate and quiet. Nothing about the hotel was outstanding, although we did use the restaurant after arriving back tired from sightseeing, and were agreeably surprised. Overall: an average Madrid hotel, OK but not outstanding for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rljrfisher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on March 16th for one night. I have no idea why this is rated number one by Trip Advisor. The rooms were plain, clean, but 60's bare finished. The first room had a malfunctioning shower and the bathroom flooded with water. The management seemed annoyed to place us in a new room. The buffett breakfast reminded me of the "cheap" hotel chains in the United States. The food was unappetizing, and unappealing. Also, the front desk was very unhelpful to answer some very simple questions. This is basic, "plain vanilla" hotel, but little else. The price matched what we received. Don't expect anything but the most bare bones accomodation. rljrfisher, Longmont, Colorado, USA

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing. Definitely not #1.”
Reviews.Author: bonedocCharleston
Reviews.Content: Satisfactory facility and good location. However the staff was VERY unhelpful and the service fair. Many other hotels near by that must be doing a better job. No way this is the #1 hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not the best”
Reviews.Author: layal.nabhan
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week end from madrid our stay was great and the hotel of II castillas has a great location we booked it aftre reading the reviews, the hotel is very confortable and has all the basic elements, it is clean and very new and enjoys a great location however it is definitely not the best hotel and it shouldn't rank as first among all the hotels in madrid, the rooms are small and the design is very has been and old fashioned the hotel is good value for money, but not a super hotel
